hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Timing
hypothesis_content.statement: After a liquidity crash event (15-day historical volatility drops from >80% to <40%), the subsequent volatility compression period of 7-10 days will resolve with a directional move >6% within 3 days of breakout, with 70% probability in the direction of the pre-crash trend.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity crashes create volatility regimes. The compression afterward represents accumulation/distribution before next structural move. In neutral/bull regimes, the tendency is to resume prior trend as liquidity returns to market.
entry_conditions: BTC 15-day historical volatility has declined from >80% to <40% over past 10 days
BTC price is within 2.5% of 20-day moving average
Average true range (14-day) has contracted by >35% from recent high

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves >6% from entry in either direction
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Volatility expands >5% without directional move >3% (false breakout)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 trading days after entry if no breakout occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakouts show no trend-following bias (<55% continue prior trend) or fail to reach 6% magnitude in majority of cases.
